overview_of_class:
RTVF479 MFA Pre-Thesis Seminar

In this seminar, first year MFA in Documentary Media students will build the foundation for their thesis project, which they will direct and complete during their second year of study. We will generate ideas, delve into research, develop a proposal and produce a demo and trailer for each thesis project. Finding the creative voice and style of the project, assessing its distribution and exhibition potential, and discussing the merits of the project will all be part of this class. Students are expected to present their projects verbally during class and will also provide critical feedback to their peers. Work on developing the thesis projects will be complemented by workshops and assignments that will help students hone specific filmmaking skills. Requirements include: short trailer, a five minute demo, plus a written proposal.

Students will be evaluated based on their attendance, participation, assignments, proposal, trailer and demo.

Required class materials include a hard drive (all MFA in Doc students should already have one) and a course packet or book (TBA) approximately $65.
